Articles.Content: Nice project! I am looking forward for my first Reentry with this Shuttle!
will you release this thing soon?

Dude, give it a rest. I think you've exceeded your quota of "are we there yet!?" posts.

helldiver and zrm _just_ explained why there's delay, and an ETA (after the end of December).

Seriously man, lay off annoying mod makers. It's super frustrating for them to have to deal with constant "Are we there yet" kind of questions. Even asking for an ETA is rude, considering this is a time consuming and unpaid hobby.
.22 support is just a matter of one line in each part.cfg to tell it where to go in the tech tree. aerospaceTech seems like a good spot.

Hay great mod when does it come out.

-Don't know maybe after I have some more free time

But it looks so good now, just release it.

-It's still buggy and will not work well. Just wait a bit so we can make it right and more fun.

BUT I WANT IT NOW!!!

-Sigh...

ETA (after the end of December).

Well, I'll get a shuttle for Christmas!

Seriously man, lay off annoying mod makers. It's super frustrating for them to have to deal with constant "Are we there yet" kind of questions. Even asking for an ETA is rude, considering this is a time consuming and unpaid hobby.

Thankyou for notifying me that i'm being so rude.

.22 borked connections and physics for some reason. ...
I noticed this too. My large refueling station which was rock solid in .21 now starts flopping around like a wet noodle with this resonant wave motion that eventually rips it into pieces.

I noticed this too. My large refueling station which was rock solid in .21 now starts flopping around like a wet noodle with this resonant wave motion that eventually rips it into pieces.

For me planes won't drive strait. a 4 wheeled plane 22 parts, goes left an right hands off.

If the issues and pluggins are for IVA?

Why not make a drone version to keep people ocupied in the mean time, a drone does not need an IVA.

Seriously man, lay off annoying mod makers. It's super frustrating for them to have to deal with constant "Are we there yet" kind of questions. Even asking for an ETA is rude, considering this is a time consuming and unpaid hobby.

What he said.

If the issues and pluggins are for IVA?

Why not make a drone version to keep people ocupied in the mean time, a drone does not need an IVA.

Or we could be patient like they've asked. That way they aren't saddled with trying to support one version whilst trying to develop another, all in their spare time. One solid release is better than two half-baked.

Fair enough, I was just thinking a drone version would let them use the playerbase to test for issues related to the parts themselfs, and not plugins, and pacify some of the people who are impatiant.

Plus...

the thing kinda looks like an x-37 any way >.<

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ee/Boeing_X-37B_inside_payload_fairing_before_launch.jpg
Wow will this ever get released? People have been waiting for like 2 firkin months!
Oh boy now you gone and done it, here come the keyboard commandos, *grabs some popcorn*

Wow will this ever get released? People have been waiting for like 2 firkin months!

It's pointless to complain about mods not being released in what you deem a timely manner. The mod creators likely have other things going on.

Wow will this ever get released? People have been waiting for like 2 firkin months!

Hahaha! Good one!

Wow will this ever get released? People have been waiting for like 2 firkin months!

Yes, We have waited a long time, but why so impateint!? A mod is better released later rather than never...

TBH, I've lost interest in this mod quite some time ago. It's trying to cram in way too many features and ends up delayed more and more. If it has gone the simple way and just focused on parts, it'd be out long ago. We've had the same thing when developing the CSS, until we decided to knock it off and release it. Yes, I know the CSS is shoddy, but for unrelated reasons we couldn't fix anyway. I'd say, drop the MFT and MFD stuff, reduce plugins to what's absolutely vital and release this. Then patch it once other stuff is ready. For the basic version, it's better to keep it simple.

I, on the other hand, want to see his shuttle as his vision is taking him. I'd rather see the work of art than a shoddy version that everyone will complain about.

December is just around the corner. What a great Christmas gift to us all.

TBH, I've lost interest in this mod quite some time ago. It's trying to cram in way too many features and ends up delayed more and more. If it has gone the simple way and just focused on parts, it'd be out long ago. We've had the same thing when developing the CSS, until we decided to knock it off and release it. Yes, I know the CSS is shoddy, but for unrelated reasons we couldn't fix anyway. I'd say, drop the MFT and MFD stuff, reduce plugins to what's absolutely vital and release this. Then patch it once other stuff is ready. For the basic version, it's better to keep it simple.

If you've lost interest then why are you here? Can everybody asking for a shoddy prerelease just lay off?

The authors already said they won't release it until it's ready and to their standards. I applaud them for not giving in and releasing it until it's done. If it was released now, this thread would be flooded with a bunch of complainers telling them about all the issues the authors already know about instead of all the complainers asking for a prerelease. Let them finish it and if you're so impatient then maybe this mod isn't for you.

Since this shuttle doesn't have any "unfixable" issues in it (like CSS did, at the time we had no capability to do anything about it), a pre-release missing MFDs, MFTs and all that feature creep would be perfectly functional. Just a shuttle, normal fuels, no frills. A lot of people would've been happy with just that, not everyone wants 10 plugins for one single-ship mod. It's not even a big shuttle, you can't build ISS with that cargobay size.

I think a lot of people are missing a point here. When I started reading this thread I was under the impression that the author was making the shuttle for himself (could be wrong here) and he was sharing his vision with everyone else.

His vision of this mod isn't done to his liking yet. He wants to release a finished product as he sees it. In his eyes, this isn't a finished product yet. He won't release it until it is finished. The only person that can say it is finished is him.

when it is finished he has indicated that he will share it with us. That is awesome and we should be grateful that he wants to do that. I'm waiting for the finished mod.

if you don't want to wait, go make one yourself.

Helldiver and and zrm, take your time and release it when you are ready. There are a lot of us that will be here, cheering you on.

Edited October 29, 2013 by BostLabs

So now this is the thread of complaints..

unfortunately, I agree with Dragon01 on 1 thing, I don't want too many plugins to run a single craft, Though if we have too I will use the amount of plugins needed. can't wait nevertheless .
